lines.text:
[At the door]
It could of all been different Mr. Walker. You should have let neature take its course... but in the end, it will anyway.
[pause]
SO LET ME IN THE FUCKING HOUSE!
Just you and me Nicole, nobody else.
Nobody else
[kisses David back]
Do you want me?
Yes.
Tell me, tell me you want me.
I want you David.
Yeah?

[nods her head]
David?
Yeah?
I love you.
My dad hates him, that's for sure.
Well that means that he knows you're sleeping together, you know it's that usual weirdo jealousy trip.
How could he possibly know we were sleeping together?
Caught ya, ya hoe! You never told me you were screwing him! You'll always remember your first, not your second, not your third, just your first.
You're not dancing.
I know.

David, I don't want to beat around the bush. I came to tell you that you're gonna stop seeing Nicole. Now, either you're as smart as you think you are and you'll just go away, or else you're gonna make things a lot harder on yourself than they have to be.
You know, Steve, you're really not a faggot.
...What?
No, I'm serious. You seem like a pretty solid guy; you should lighten up on yourself.
We're not talkin' about me, we're talkin'...
Yes we are. That's what this whole thing's about, Steve. Your inadequacies. Your fears.
You just wait a minute...

Listen to me. See, I'm hip to your problems. All of 'em. I know you abandoned Nicole when she needed you most... 'cause I licked her sweet tears. I know about things comin' apart at work. Maybe you fuckin' lost it in that department. I also know you ain't keepin' up, so to speak, your end of the bargain with the missus. 'Cause if you were she wouldn't be all over my stick. Relax, Steve. We're friends. We're practically family.

I want you to understand somethin', pal. If you don't disappear from my family's life, I'm gonna rip your balls off and shove 'em so far up your ass they'll come out your fuckin' mouth! You got that, my friend?
Isn't this the car they stopped making 'cause it, I don't know, blows up or something?
Guess that's why I got her.
Hey Mr. Walka!
Dad?
Daughter?
Is it absolutely mandatory that I see James Taylor again?
When did you ever see a James Taylor concert?
You, me, Mom, summer of '85. Does that ring any bells?
'85? You'd have been...
Six.
Oh, come on, that doesn't count. I'm surprised you even remember it.
I don't think there's a thing that's ever happened - or not happened, for that matter - that I don't remember. You're the one who blocks out the past.
Nicole, I don't block out anything. It just takes longer to... sort through 40 years of... data than it does 16.
Maybe you oughta consider upgrading to a faster chip.

[laughs]
You know, sometimes you're pretty funny.
I have my moments.

[after finding Nicole's note - "I'm sorry if I caused you to worry. It's over with David" - he checks on his daughter in her bedroom]
Nic?
Please, Dad. I don't want to talk about it. I just want to be alone.
Okay... The pain will go away, honey. I promise.

[CUTTING-ROOM-FLOOR LINE]
How about the scars? Will those go away, too?
...I'm not sure. I hope so.
[He retires]
Everybody says one thing and then does another.
Do yourself a favor and don't think so much. It gives you premature wrinkles.
What's the big deal?
The big deal, Laura, is that the guy gives me the creeps, and the girl is my daughter.

[preparing to execute Steve]
Daddy, you will forever hold your peace.
[Nicole produces the "peace pipe" letter-opener and buries it in David's back]

deadpan]
Oh, no you don't.

[as David gets up and turns to face Nicole, she stands ready for him, despite no longer being sure of what he intends to do with her. Then Steve gets up and pounces on David from behind. They fight murderously as Nicole looks on in tears. Finally, Steve gets the upper hand; he choke-holds David, while turning toward Nicole's bedroom window]

[CUTTING-ROOM-FLOOR LINE]
... I've spent my whole life taking the easy way out, David. Now, IT'S YOUR TURN!
[David is thrown headlong through the window and plummets to his death. Steve then turns back to face Nicole]

softly]
... Dad, are you all right?

[CUTTING-ROOM-FLOOR LINE]
... I didn't abandon you this time.
[She runs into his arms and they hug each other]

sobbing]
... I wanted to save David from himself, in spite of everything. I'm sorry I couldn't.

[CUTTING-ROOM-FLOOR LINE]
Well, I didn't do so hot either, not on that score... But I think we BOTH did the next best thing, don't you?

forcing a smile]
Touché, Dad.
[Laura, Margo and Toby come in and group-hug them both]

[finds them playing "Street Fighter"]
Hey there, handsome. How soon are you gonna grow up, so I can ravage you?
Leave Toby alone, Margo.

[CUTTING-ROOM-FLOOR LINE]
When did you start sticking up for this guy? I thought you couldn't stand him.

[CUTTING-ROOM-FLOOR LINE]
She can't; Mom had to force her to come downstairs and hang out with me.

[CUTTING-ROOM-FLOOR LINE]
Well, at least he hasn't done what *you* did... I need some fresh air.

[her first line, as she comes in for breakfast wearing a sexy minidress - and notices Steve's disapproving gaze]
What?
Nothin'.
Dad, you're looking at me like you didn't know who I was or something.
No, no. I was just thinking that maybe you'd like Laura to take you to buy new clothes.
What she's got on is brand-new.
*This* is NEW?
Yeah. Why? What's wrong with it?
It looks like something you wore when you were 12.
Yeah, so?
Look. All I'm saying is that it's - it's... What? I'm not allowed to have an opinion?
No, Dad; *you're* allowed to do whatever you want. *I'm* the one who needs permission to breathe. So may I please go to school now, Father?

[his first line, as he comes in]
Good morning, everybody.
wolf-whistles]
That dress looks great on you, Nicole.

grins in spite of herself]
Thanks, I *think*.
[she departs]
Have a nice day, Nicole.
[to Laura]
Does *that* count as quality time?

[as she and Steve are leaving for Vancouver; to Nicole and Toby]
The number of the hotel is by the phone. So just rent some videos, call Domino's, and try not to kill each other.
I'll try and restrain myself.
Relax, Mom. If she gives me any trouble, I'll just sic Kaiser on her.
Ooh-whoo; I'm shaking.

[CUTTING-ROOM-FLOOR LINE]
You're right, that was a bluff; he likes you more than me, anyway.
Try and have a nice time, Nic. Life is short. But nobody in the house but you and Toby. You hear me?
I hear you, Dad.
Smile?
[she forces a smile]

[CUTTING-ROOM-FLOOR LINE]
That won't be a problem; none of the kids at school like me enough to come over.

right after killing Terry with Laura's SUV]
... Consider that a present from Kaiser.

as she and Steve are barricading the doors, Laura notices Hacker reaching through a hole in their front door for the deadbolt. She produces an electric drill and pierces Hacker's hand with it]
Not by the hair on my fucking chin!

Nicole and Toby are chatting over ice cream at Baskin-Robbins]
... Mom always tells you to wear a robe because of me? That's crazy. I'd never peep at you; you're my big sister.
First of all, I know that - even if she doesn't. Second of all, I *like* it when YOU peep at me.
Wow, I'm gonna have to remember that...! Cindy Crawford, now SHE'S a different story...

[laughing]
She's also MRS. Richard Gere, remember?
Oh, yeah - right.
[as she happily ruffles her little brother's hair, Nicole notices David nearby. He is filming her and Toby with a video-camera]
...Do you know how to flip someone the bird?
How about biting my thumb at them, like in "Romeo and Juliet"?
Close enough. Show me.
[as Toby executes a picture-perfect thumb-bite, Nicole reaches out and aims him toward David - who stops taping. Nicole and Toby laugh some more]
Come on, Tobster... We're out of here.
[as they both exit, Nicole looks to where David stood a moment ago. He has disappeared]
Nicole, get me a Coke.
You filthy little whore!
[first lines]

[calling upstairs to Nicole in the shower]
Nicole, save some hot water for your father!
[last lines]

[physically fighting David]
Now, you get out of here!
...She's got this little chain she hooks through it and wraps around her waist. What would Dad do if I got one?
You know exactly what he would do.
Yeah, firing squad at dawn.
Toby.

[CUTTING-ROOM-FLOOR LINE]
Not that bad, huh...?
[to Nicole]

[CUTTING-ROOM-FLOOR LINE]
No, more likely he'd just make you share my bedroom for a week or so.

[CUTTING-ROOM-FLOOR LINE]
In other words, he'd actually punish YOU for something *I* did?

[CUTTING-ROOM-FLOOR LINE]
Quit torturing yourself; that's MY job.

agrees with a laugh]
Totally!

[CUTTING-ROOM-FLOOR LINE]
*Both of you.*

ruffling his hair]
The firing squad would be more humane.
[Toby mimes getting stabbed, then looks up at Nicole with his best "You got me that time" expression]

Steve and Laura bicker about his cancellation of a family outing due to an emergency at work. As the argument escalates, their offspring listen in from the next room]
... I hate it when they fight.
Have they argued more often since I came to live here?

[thinking it over]
... Not more often. Just longer and harder.
[Nicole chuckles]
... Seriously, why do people bother getting married, if they're just gonna divorce?

[she puts an arm around his shoulders]
THEY'RE not getting divorced, little guy.
When *I* get married, it'll only be ONCE - and FOREVER.

[she buries her face in his hair and kisses him]
ME TOO.

[he slides an arm around her waist and gently pats her hip]
Maybe you and I should get married, then.

[she laughs]
Toby, why would you want to marry ME? Everything's already great between us; let's not spoil it, huh?

[he smiles mischievously]
We COULD have just one kid, and then see how it goes.
What...? *We could do WHAT?*
[They embrace, giggling at the idea]
... Tobias, what am I gonna do with you?
[she nuzzles him]
Sorry, sorry, sorry. Mr. Kehele decided he'd have to stare at my boobs for ten minutes before he'd give me an extension.

[on the phone]
... Okay, fine. You're right. It's not an emergency. All the same, could I please talk to the people that try and solve murders - ? Jesus!

[sees Kaiser's head poking through the "doggy door"]
Come on. That's a good boy.
[the dog's head, and ONLY its head, is shoved through and rolls across the floor]
Come here, Toby. Over here.
[He runs into her arms and they hug each other]
... I'm sorry you had to see that, bro.

[still on the phone]
... Yeah, um - My - My name is Steven - Hello - Hello? HELLO?... The phone is dead.
You're next, man!
[Steve begins to rush after him, but Laura stops him]
No, wait! We don't know whether he's alone out there. Here, security will come.
[She taps a control panel repeatedly, but nothing happens]
There's not even a siren.
Well, Larry will still get the signal.
No, it's disconnected. The system works through the phone lines...
Nicole, can I borrow him?
[Nicole nods and dismissively pats Toby's shoulder]
Over here, Toby.
[He goes over to Margo and they share a tender embrace]
...It doesn't matter. No one is getting in here. You designed it, remember? Reinforced doors. No entry without the code.
Dad...? David's got the code.

[There is a beeping as David punches in the entry code. Steve hits the manual override just in time, thus keeping the door locked. There is banging and pounding as David's hoods attempt to break in through the windows and side doors]
Nicole, take Margo and Toby up to your room and stay there.
Will *you* be okay?
Laura and I will be fine. Laura, get the flashlight. Then turn off every light in the house!
[Halfway up the stairs, Nicole screams as Logan leers in at her through a skylight]
*Nicole!* I'm counting on you three guys to make sure they don't get in from upstairs! If that happens...!
I get it, Dad. Good luck to you.
Thanks, now GO ON! AND LOCK YOUR DOOR!
[as Nicole ushers Margo and Toby to her room, Steve turns back to Laura]
Turn the flashlight off. I don't want them to know where anybody is.
[the doorbell rings continuously]
No one's gonna hurt our family, honey. No one!
[Upstairs, Nicole sits with Toby on her bed while a tearful Margo paces the floor nearby. Toby gazes around the darkened room, and then forces a smile at his sister]

[CUTTING-ROOM FLOOR-LINE]
... You always said, if you ever invited me in here, it'd be the greatest day of my life.
[Nicole returns the smile and kisses him tenderly]

[CUTTING-ROOM FLOOR-LINE]
I'm still working that one out; give me time.
[Margo sobs loudly]
I'll be right back, Tobster.
Oh, they're gonna kill us, just like they killed Gary.
Don't say that. You need to calm down.
[Toby notices Terry outside the bedroom window, and waves for the girls' attention. Margo screams, while Nicole produces an umbrella]
Toby! Coming through!
[as Toby rejoins Margo, Nicole jabs Terry with the umbrella and he plummets to the yard below. Toby is duly impressed]

[CUTTING-ROOM FLOOR-LINE]
Take a bow, Rapunzel.
[In response to the joke, Nicole beams at him and flips her hair, a la "CHARLIE'S ANGELS"]
The Washington Post has got to see something before they can make me Editor.
